subject: thoughts to live by
verse: To Him who has loved us and freed us from our sins by His Blood. to Him be glory and power for ever! Amen. (Revelation 1:5, 6)
reflection: He "has freed us from our sins, " John wrote. Lent is not only a time for the upward look at God's love but also for the inward look at our selves. What do I see when I look at myself? ~ Is it someone worthy of God's love ~ or is it someone with sin's dirt embedded beneath the fingernails of daily life? ~ Is it someone who's walk is squeaky clean ~ or whose mind, tongue, and actions look as though they've spent time in sin's mud holes? The inward look quickly reminds me how amazing God's love is to reach so low to sinners like me. What did it cost God to free me from my sins? ~ "Blood, " John said. The cross was no decoration or ornament for Jesus. It was filled with pain and smeared with His precious blood. Yes it's time to look up again and marvel at such love.
prayer: Dear Lord, fill me with thankfulness and awe each time I hear the message of Your salvation. Amen.
original_content:
03/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~LENT AND LOVE

Our Bible Verses for Today:
To Him who has loved us and freed us from our sins by His Blood .
to Him be glory and power for ever! Amen. (Rev. 1:5, 6)

Our Lesson for Today:
He "has freed us from our sins," John wrote. Lent is not only a time for 
the upward look at God's love but also for the inward look at our selves.

What do I see when I look at myself? ~ Is it someone worthy of God's
love ~ or is it someone with sin's dirt imbedded beneath the fingernails of
daily life? ~ Is it someone who's walk is squeaky clean ~ or whose mind, 
tongue, and actions look as though they've spent time in sin's mud holes?

The inward look quickly reminds me how amazing God's love is to reach so 
low to sinners like me...

What did it cost God to free me from my sins? ~ "Blood," John said. The cross
was no decoration or ornament for Jesus. It was filled with pain and smeared with 
His precious blood. Yes it's time to look up again and marvel at such love...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, fill me with thankfulness and awe each time
I hear the message of Your salvation...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: They have pierced My hands and My feet. (Psalms 22:16)
reflection: Scars on our hands ~ maybe from some knife that slipped or disease that crippled. there's usually a story behind those scars. Jesus' hands have scares too and behind them is the greatest story the world has ever heard. David foretold it, and the gospels record it, using simple words. But there was nothing simple about it. Splintery wood and sharp nails, torn flesh and screaming nerve endings, constant pain and slow death ~ was involved in crucifixion. and far worse were the tortures of hell. All the pains of hell that were the wages for the world's sins crushed down on Jesus pierced on that cross. Only the devils and the damned in hell can begin to understand. We can only guess at what this involved for Jesus. There's no guessing, though, as to who pierced His hands and feet. Don't forget for a moment it was "I who pierced His hands and His feet." I with my many sins did it. So look at those nail-pierced hands! They have a story to tell. They speak of full payment for the world's sins. THEY SPEAK ~ THEY SHOUT ~ TO ME ABOUT MY SALVATION!
prayer: Dear Lord, help me listen! Amen.
original_content:
03/03/2010~~~food for thought~~~THOSE NAIL-PIERCED HANDS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
They have pierced My hands and My feet...(Ps. 22:16)

Our Lesson for Today:
Scars on our hands ~ maybe from some knife that slipped or disease that crippled.
there's usually a story behind those scars. Jesus' hands have scares too and behind 
them is the greatest story the world has ever heard...

David foretold it, and the gospels record it, using simple words. But there was nothing 
simple about it. Splintery wood and sharp nails, torn flesh and screaming nerve endings, 
constant pain and slow death ~ was involved in crucifixion. and far worse were the tortures
of hell...

All the pains of hell that were the wages for the world's sins crushed down on Jesus
pierced on that cross. Only the devils and the damned in hell can begin to understand.
We can only guess at what this involved for Jesus...

There's no guessing, though, as to who pierced His hands and feet. Don't forget for a 
moment it was "I who pierced His hands and His feet." I with my many sins did it...
So look at those nail-pierced hands! They have a story to tell. They speak of full payment 
for the world's sins. THEY SPEAK ~ THEY SHOUT ~ TO ME ABOUT MY SALVATION!

Dear Lord, help me listen! Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When I tried to keep the law, I realized I could never earn God's approval. So I died to the law so that I might live for God. I have been crucified with Christ. (Galatians 2:19)
reflection: Through the study of the Old Testament Scriptures, Paul realized that he could not be save by obeying God's laws. The prophets knew that God's plan of salvation did not rest on keeping the law. The reason is we have all been infected by sin, and so we can not keep God's law perfectly. BUT fortunately, God has provided a way of salvation that depends on Jesus Christ, not on our own efforts. Even though we know this truth, we must guard against the temptation of using service, good deeds, charitable giving, OR any other effort as a substitute for faith.
prayer: Thank You Lord, for being a substitute for me. Amen.
original_content:
03/04/2010~~~~food for thought~~~FOR ME HE WAS CRUCIFIED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
When I tried to keep the law, I realized I could never earn God's approval.
So I died to the law so that I might live for God. I have been crucified with
Christ...(Gal 2:19)

Our Lesson for Today:
Through the study of the Old Testament Scriptures, Paul realized that he 
could not be save by obeying God's laws. The prophets knew that God's 
plan of salvation did not rest on keeping the law...

The reason is we have all been infected by sin, and so we can not keep God's
law perfectly. BUT fortunately, God has provided a way of salvation that depends
on Jesus Christ, not on our own efforts...

Even though we know this truth, we must guard against the temptation of using

Prayer Suggestion:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I myself no longer live, but Christ lives in me. So I live my life in this earthly body by trusting in the Son of God, Who loved me and gave Himself for me. (Galatians 2:20)
reflection: Here is a question we may hear now and then, "How have we been crucified with Christ?" The answer is Legally, God looks at us as if we had died with Christ. Because our sins died with Him, we are no longer condemned (Colossians 2:13-15). Relationally, ~ we have become one with Christ, and His experiences are ours. Our Christian life began when, in unity with Him, we died to our old life (see Romans 6:5-11). In our daily life, ~ we must regularly crucify sinful desires that keep us from following Christ. This, too, is a kind of dying with Him (Luke 9:23-25). AND yet, the focus of Christianity is not dying but living. BECAUSE we have been crucified with Christ, we ALSO have been raised with Him (Romans 6:5). He is our power for living AND our hope for the future (Colossians 1:27).
prayer: Thank You Lord, for offering Yourself for my sins, Thank You Lord, for the power for living and my hope for the future, a place You have prepared for me. Amen.
original_content:
03/05/2010~~~food for thought~~~FOR ME HE DIED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I myself no longer live, but Christ lives in me. So I live my life in this earthly
body by trusting in the Son of God, Who loved me and gave Himself for me. (Gal. 2:20)

Our Lesson for Today:
Here is a question we may hear now and then, "How have we been crucified with Christ?"
The answer is Legally, God looks at us as if we had died with Christ. Because our sins 
died with Him, we are no longer condemned (Col. 2:13-15).

Relationally, ~ we have become one with Christ, and His experiences are ours.
Our Christian life began when, in unity with Him, we died to our old life (see Ro. 6:5-11).

In our daily life, ~ we must regularly crucify sinful desires that keep us from following
Christ. This, too, is a kind of dying with Him (Lk. 9:23-25). AND yet, the focus of Christianity 
is not dying but living. BECAUSE we have been crucified with Christ, we ALSO have been
raised with Him (Ro. 6:5)... He is our power for living AND our hope for the future (Col. 1:27).

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You Lord, for offering Yourself for my sins,
Thank You Lord, for the power for living and my hope
for the future, a place You have prepared for me...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I do not set aside the grace of God, for if righteousness could be gained by keeping the law, then Christ died for nothing. (Galatians 2:21)
reflection: It is sad to say that believers today may still be in danger of acting as if Christ died for nothing. HOW? By believing they can earn God's favor by what they do. ~ HOW SO? They are not trusting completely in Christ's work on the cross. By struggling to appropriate God's power to change themselves, they are not resting in God's power to save them. IF we could be saved by being good, then Christ would not have had to die. But the cross is the only way to salvation. In John 4:34 Jesus says: "He came to finish God's work of salvation." John 17:4 He did everything that was required, to pay the full penalty for our sins. NOW, we can freely approach God because of what Jesus did for us ~ Those who believe in Jesus' death and resurrection can live eternally with God and escape the penalty that comes from sin. .
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You, for loving me so much that You were willing to die for me. Amen.
original_content:

gained by keeping the law, then Christ died for nothing...(Gal. 2:21)

In John 4:34 Jesus says: "He came to finish God's work of salvation."

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The virgin will be with child and will give birth to a son, and they will call Him Immanuel" which means, God with us." (Matthew 1:23)
reflection: What a beautiful name for my Savior, Immanuel ~ God with us. In this statement there are two comforting truths. The first is that Jesus is God. If you were to eliminate that truth what would that baby mean to me? He'd be just another baby. And what would that figure on the cross 33 years later mean to me? He'd just be another innocent victim nailed there by some miscarriage of justice. If He were not God, then His blood could hardly purify me from all sin. The second truth is in his name Immanuel also "God with us." What a comforting thought, He is never far from us. He is with us in our flesh, on our globe, He is near even when I sin, not to cause them or share in them but to save me from them. He has already paid for them. Yes He is with us through every trial, giving us the strength to keep moving forward.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for coming to the manger and the cross to be my only Savior. Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (The angel said to Joseph concerning Mary) "And she will have a son, and you are to name Him Jesus." (Matthew 1:21)
reflection: How often do you think of what the name 'Jesus' means? It means, "The Lord saves." Jesus came to earth to save us because we can not save ourselves from sin and its consequences. No matter how good we are, we can't eliminate the sinful nature present in all of us. ONLY Jesus can do that. Jesus DID NOT come to help people save themselves; He came to be their Savior from the power and penalty of sin. We should continually thank Jesus for His death on the cross for our sins, AND THEN ask Him to take control of our life. Your new life begins at that very moment.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for being my substitute, in going the way of the cross. Come into my heart, and take control of my life. Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (John the Baptist said:) Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world! (John 1:29)
reflection: (A little O. T. history lesson) Every morning and evening, a lamb was sacrificed in the temple for the sins of the people (Exodus 29:38-42). Isaiah 53:7 prophesied that the Messiah, God's servant, would be led to the slaughter like a lamb. (N. T. history lesson) To pay the penalty for sin, a life had to be given ~ and God chose to provide the sacrifice Himself. The sins of the world were removed when Jesus died as the perfect sacrifice. This is the way our sins are forgiven (I Corinthians 5:7)... The sin of the world means everyone's sin, the sin of each individual. Jesus paid the price of your sin by His death. Yes you can receive forgiveness by merely confessing your sin to Him and asking for His forgiveness.
prayer: Thank You, Lord, for becoming the lamb and shedding Your blood for me. Forgive me for my sins of thought word and deed. Amen.
original_content:
03/09/2010~~~food for thought~~~PRAISE FOR HIS NAME ~ THE LAMB...

Our Bible Verse for Today: (John the Baptist said:)
"Look, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin
of the world! (Jn. 1:29)

Our Lesson for Today: (A little O. T. history lesson)
Every morning and evening, a lamb was sacrificed in the temple 
for the sins of the people (Exodus 29:38-42). Isaiah 53:7 prophesied
that the Messiah, God's servant, would be led to the slaughter like a lamb...

(N. T. history lesson) To pay the penalty for sin, a life had to be given ~ 
and God chose to provide the sacrifice Himself. The sins of the world were 
removed when Jesus died as the perfect sacrifice. This is the way our sins 
are forgiven (I Cor. 5:7)...

The "sin of the world" means everyone's sin, the sin of each individual.
Jesus paid the price of your sin by His death. Yes you can receive forgiveness
by merely confessing your sin to Him and asking for His forgiveness...

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You, Lord, for becoming the lamb and shedding Your 
blood for me. Forgive me for my sins of thought word and deed...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Now the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honor and glory for ever and ever. Amen. (I Tim 1:17)
reflection: Look at what my King brings. Earthly kings tax and take from their subjects. Jesus only gives, even offering up Himself for me. Earthly rulers demand with a heavy hand. Jesus offers with winsome love. Earthly rulers fill their coffers with the coins of their people. Jesus, through His death, has prepared treasures in heaven for me. Yes He promises perfect care for all His subjects even me, and perfect peace for our hearts. Already here on earth I am a citizen of His kingdom. My baptismal certificate is proof on my citizenship. Just wait till in heaven I share with the eternal, immortal King fully in His realm. What a name, King My Savior-God has, one that deserves my praise all my days.
prayer: Eternal God, thank you for coming as my King to make me a citizen of heaven. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End. (Revelation 22:13)
reflection: The book of Revelation calls Jesus "the Alpha and the Omega" four times. We'd probably say "A and Z" Just as those two letters are the first and the last in our alphabet, so Alpha and Omega are in the Greek. Why is this a good name for Jesus? ~ First of all, because He's our Eternal Savior. His salvation is forever. Nothing new will ever take it's place. Unlike our cars with new models every year or our computers where hardware and software are obsolete almost before we buy, Jesus' salvation stays the same. There is no Savior before Him, nor any after Him. He truly is the First and the Last. Jesus is all-sufficient, His salvation offers my soul all it ever needs. Nothing ever has to be added. ~ no updated part will ever have to be attached. His words on Calvary's cross, "It is finished, " still mean that sin is canceled and salvation is complete. Whether I call Him Alpha and Omega ~ or A and Z Jesus is all I'll ever need.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, thank you for being my one and only, all-sufficient Savior. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Where did this man get these thing?. . Isn't this the carpenter? (Mark 6:2, 3)
reflection: They called Him "The carpenter" that day to belittle Him. Yet when we stop to think, isn't that a good name for Jesus? He's the heavenly Carpenter. Just think what a carpenter does. He builds and fixes."Through Him all things were made, " John 1:3 reminds me. Till time's end, He's still busy."On this rock I will build my church, " He said (Matthew 16:18) With His gospel this Carpenter adds people to His invisible church of believers that reaches into eternity, ~ best of all He's my Carpenter. Not only did He make me through my parents. He also remade me, turning the sinful wreck I was from my mother's womb into a believer and fixing every day dents sin still gouges into my faith. What a name, Carpenter, my Savior-God has, one that deserves my praise all my days!
prayer: Lord, thank You for crafting and keeping me as something precious for Your Father's house. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am the way. No one comes to the Father except through Me. (John 14:6)
reflection: How often have we turned to the one reading a map and asked the question, "Which road do I take, " when entering a strange city? ~ When the way to heaven is involved, we better have the right road, or we'll waste more than time. Jesus knows where we want to go. Ever since sin slammed shut not only the door to Eden but also to heaven, Man's been looking for the road back. Like some prodigal son, He's been roaming far from home, but unlike that boy, he doesn't know the way back. Though he tries to push his anxious concerns about eternity to the back of his mind, they still sit there bothering him. But we know the way! ~ Jesus has told us."I am the way." He's not just some highway marker like the one pointing to the bypass around some strange city. He's the road itself. and what a highway He is! ~ Straight as an arrow. ~ smoother than freshly cured cement. Never a detour and not one orange barrel. No toll booths to clog up the traffic flow and collect our cash. He is the way, the only way to the Father's house above. With His death and resurrection as payment for all sin, He made Himself the freeway to heaven, one that asks nothing from us, because it took everything from Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, direct and keep my feet in faith on You as the only way to the Fathers house. Amen.
original_content:

Never a detour and not one orange barrel. No toll booths to clog up the traffic flow and

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am. the Truth. No one comes to the Father except through Me. (John 14:6)
reflection: The world is filled with all kinds of truth. People have rummaged in the ruins of the past, they've worked at classifying the animal, vegetable, mineral kingdoms, split atoms, and orbited satellites. Yet none of these so-called truths can answer the question, What must I do to be saved? There only Jesus will do. That's His claim when He says, "I am the truth." Notice what He says. It isn't "I am truthful." BUT of course He is. The sinless Son of God cannot lie. NOR does He say, "I'll tell you the truth." The prophets and apostles did that. They were only mouthpieces, proclaiming truths that were given to them. Jesus is so much more. Jesus is truth itself. If it were mathematics, we'd say, "Jesus = truth" or "Jesus = salvation." He is truth in action. What a name, the Truth, my Savior-God has, one that deserves my praise all my days!
prayer: Dear Lord, fill my heart with You as my Savior for then I will know the way to my Father. Amen.
original_content:
03/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~PRAISE FOR HIS NAME ~ THE TRUTH...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I am...the Truth...No one comes to the Father except
through Me...(John 14:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
The world is filled with all kinds of truth. People have rummaged in the ruins of the past,
they've worked at classifying the animal, vegetable, mineral kingdoms, split atoms,
and orbited satellites. Yet none of these so-called truths can answer the question, 
What must I do to be saved?

There only Jesus will do. That's His claim when He says, "I am the truth." Notice what
He says. It isn't "I am truthful." BUT of course He is. The sinless Son of God cannot lie.
NOR does He say, "I'll tell you the truth." The prophets and apostles did that. They were 
only mouthpieces, proclaiming truths that were given to them. Jesus is so much more...

Jesus is truth itself. If it were mathematics, we'd say, "Jesus = truth" or "Jesus = salvation."
He is truth in action. What a name, the Truth, my Savior-God has, one that deserves my 
praise all my days!

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, fill my heart with You as my Savior for then
I will know the way to my Father...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am. the life. No one can come to the Father except through me. (John 14:6)
reflection: Do you know CPR? ~ What about spiritual life? ~ How much do you know? When Jesus said "I am the life, " He was referring to spiritual life. He was making the point that without Him, people are dead beyond the point of resuscitation. True, many exist each day without Him. They walk and talk, work and play, marry and bury, but as dead people. When God looks at them, He sees only spiritual corpses bound only for hell's bonfire. No wonder Scripture describes hell as everlasting death. It's the dead end for souls that without the Savior can only be dead in unbelief. Only in Jesus am I alive because only in Him is sin's pardon and heaven's hope. As one church father put it, "Without the Way, there is no going; without the Truth, there is no knowing; without the life, there is no living." What a name, the Life, my Savior-God has, one that deserves my praise all my days.
prayer: Dear Lord, You've made me alive through faith. Keep me alive till I reach heaven's door. Amen.
original_content:
03/15/2010~~~food for thought~~~PRAISE FOR HIS NAME ~ THE LIFE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I am...the life...No one can come to the Father except through me...(Jn. 14:6)

Our Lesson for Today:
Do you know CPR? ~ What about spiritual life? ~ How much do you know?
When Jesus said "I am the life," He was referring to spiritual life. He was
making the point that without Him, people are dead beyond the point of
resuscitation. True, many exist each day without Him. They walk and talk,
work and play, marry and bury, but as dead people. When God looks at 
them, He sees only spiritual corpses bound only for hell's bonfire...

No wonder Scripture describes hell as everlasting death. It's the dead end 
for souls that without the Savior can only be dead in unbelief. Only in Jesus 
am I alive because only in Him is sin's pardon and heaven's hope. As one
church father put it, "Without the Way, there is no going; without the Truth,
there is no knowing; without the life, there is no living."
What a name, the Life, my Savior-God has, one that deserves
my praise all my days...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, You've made me alive through faith.
Keep me alive till I reach heaven's door... Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Being in anguish, He prayed more earnestly, and His sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground. (Luke 22:44)
reflection: What was it that caused my Savior to plead "Take this cup from me, " in the garden? I hope we don't forget the answer we have heard in other Lenten seasons. That cup was filled with the bitter portions of Hell's punishment for sin. No wonder Jesus turns to His Father pleading, "Take this cup from me." Who can disagree that sin must be serious, look what it does to Jesus. Each of my sins was a drop of poison in that cup, Each one brought drops of blood to Jesus' scalp. How Jesus must love me to be willing to do this for a sinner like me! Gethsemane was only an olive garden in those days. But I remember it because of Jesus' wondrous love.
prayer: Dear Lord, when my sins give me alarm, show me again Your love in Gethsemane's garden. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Peter denies knowing Christ) At that moment the Lord turned and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered that the Lord had said, "Before the rooster crows tomorrow morning, you will deny Me three times." (Luke 22:62)
reflection: Peter wept bitterly, not only because he realized that he had denied his Lord, the Messiah, but also because he had turned away from a very dear friend, a person who had loved and taught him for three years. Peter said that he would never deny Christ. But when frightened, he went against all he had boldly promised. Unable to stand up for his Lord for even 12 hours, he had failed as a disciple and as a friend. We need to be aware of own breaking points and not become overconfident or self-sufficient. If we fail Him, we must remember that Christ can use those who recognize their failure. From his humiliating experience Peter learned much that would help him later when he assumed leadership of the young church.
prayer: Dear Lord, You know my weakness, look upon me with Your love and reclaim me when I stray. Amen.
original_content:
03/17/2010~~~food for thought~~~HIS LOVE NEVER FAILS...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
(Peter denies knowing Christ) At that moment the Lord turned and looked
at Peter. Then Peter remembered that the Lord had said, "Before the rooster 
crows tomorrow morning, you will deny Me three times." (Lk. 22:62)

Our Lesson for Today:
Peter wept bitterly, not only because he realized that he had denied his Lord,
the Messiah, but also because he had turned away from a very dear friend, a 
person who had loved and taught him for three years. Peter said that he would 
never deny Christ...

But when frightened, he went against all he had boldly promised. Unable to 
stand up for his Lord for even 12 hours, he had failed as a disciple and as a
friend...

We need to be aware of own breaking points and not become overconfident
or self-sufficient. If we fail Him, we must remember that Christ can use those 
who recognize their failure. From his humiliating experience Peter learned much 
that would help him later when he assumed leadership of the young church...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, You know my weakness, look upon me with
Your love and reclaim me when I stray...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: (Jesus before the council of religious leaders) The time is soon coming when I, the Son of man, will be sitting at God's right hand in the place of power." (Luke 22:69)
reflection: The accused was totally innocent and yet completely guilty. An impartial eye could pick out the flaws in His trial. Jesus was standing before a kangaroo court that only needed an appropriate charge for the verdict already decided."Guilty, " the court judged Him, though He was totally innocent. Our was He? In heaven a Higher Judge was on the bench. And He had already declared His sinless, perfect Son guilty, horribly guilty, because of the load He was carrying. Remember what the load was? "We all, like sheep, have gone astray." Isaiahwrote (53:6). Remember how he continued? "And the Lord has laid on Him the iniquity of us all." How do we begin to describe the guilt that the Father saw, when He looked at our substitute in that courtroom? Even more, how do we begin to explain the love that made it happen? Someday it'll be my turn in court, and I who am completely guilty, will be declared totally innocent. Let the unbelievers, shiver at the thought of standing before the Righteous Judge on that last day.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, thank You for taking my guilt and giving me Your innocence. Amen.
original_content:
03/18/2010~~~food for thought~~~CAN WE EXPLAIN THE LOVE?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
(Jesus before the council of religious leaders)
The time is soon coming when I, the Son of man, will be sitting
at God's right hand in the place of power." (Lk. 22:69)

Our Lesson for Today:
The accused was totally innocent and yet completely guilty. An impartial eye could 
pick out the flaws in His trial. Jesus was standing before a kangaroo court that only
needed an appropriate charge for the verdict already decided."Guilty," the court 
judged Him, though He was totally innocent...

Our was He? In heaven a Higher Judge was on the bench. And He had already 
declared His sinless, perfect Son guilty, horribly guilty, because of the load He 
was carrying. Remember what the load was? "We all, like sheep, have gone astray."
Isa. wrote (53:6). Remember how he continued? "And the Lord has laid on Him the
iniquity of us all."

How do we begin to describe the guilt that the Father saw, when He looked at our
substitute in that courtroom? Even more, how do we begin to explain the love that
made it happen?

Someday it'll be my turn in court, and I who am completely guilty, will be declared 
totally innocent. Let the unbelievers, shiver at the thought of standing before the
Righteous Judge on that last day.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, thank You for taking my guilt
and giving me Your innocence...Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He [Herod] asked Jesus, question after question, but Jesus refused to answer. (Luke 23:9)
reflection: We just aren't used to Jesus being silent. ~ Isn't this the same Jesus who went everywhere preaching the gospel? ~ Yet before Herod's judgment seat, the Savior remained silent. Well Peter tells us why, "When they hurled their insults at Him, He didn't retaliate; when He suffered, He made no threats. ~ Instead, He entrusted Himself to Him who judges justly" (I Peter 2:23). Did you hear that? ~ Jesus' silence was dictated by His love. ~ Instead of striking back at His enemies, He said nothing. ~ His love wouldn't let Him hurt them. ~ Instead of hurling greater insults at them, He was silent. His love for His Father wouldn't do what His Father said was wrong. ~ Love dictated His silence. But He has words for me."Go in peace, " He says when I haul my tonnage of sin before Him each day." ~ "Plunged into the depths of the sea, " He comforts me when those "special" sins rub my conscience sore. ~ From His silence before Herod come words of wondrous love.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, continue to tell me of Your saving love and keep my heart listening. Amen.
original_content:
03/19/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHAT WONDROUS LOVE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
He [Herod] asked Jesus, question after question, but Jesus refused 
to answer...(Lk. 23:9)

Our Lesson for Today:
We just aren't used to Jesus being silent. ~ Isn't this the same Jesus who went 
everywhere preaching the gospel? ~ Yet before Herod's judgment seat, the Savior
remained silent...

Well Peter tells us why, "When they hurled their insults at Him, He didn't retaliate;
when He suffered, He made no threats. ~ Instead, He entrusted Himself to Him
who judges justly" (I Peter 2:23). Did you hear that? ~ Jesus' silence was dictated
by His love. ~ Instead of striking back at His enemies, He said nothing. ~ His love
wouldn't let Him hurt them. ~ Instead of hurling greater insults at them, He was silent.
His love for His Father wouldn't do what His Father said was wrong. ~ Love dictated
His silence... 

But He has words for me."Go in peace," He says when I haul my tonnage of sin before 
Him each day." ~ "Plunged into the depths of the sea," He comforts me when those
"special" sins rub my conscience sore. ~ From His silence before Herod come words
of wondrous love...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, continue to tell me of Your saving love
and keep my heart listening...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus turned and said to them, "Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me; weep for yourselves and for you children." (Luke 23:28)
reflection: Wouldn't we have cried too, if we had been standing with those women? ~ And wouldn't you think that Jesus would have wanted our tears? When we suffer, don't we appreciate sympathy. But not our Lord Jesus. Dragging His cross through the streets of Jerusalem, he says, "Do not weep for Me." Why not? ~ Because all was well with Him. ~ He knew that the way His Father had chosen to free the world from sin's hellish curse was by His making those bloody footprints to a hill called Calvary. ~ As the loving Son of the Eternal Father and as the everlasting friend of sinners, He was willing to walk that path. It is time to check our heart and life again, isn't it? ~ Any sin there that we've become comfortable with? ~ Any sin that we've willingly made our bedfellow? ~ Is there any sin that we've told God to keep His fingers off? ~ Well then perhaps it's time to hear His words of love warning us, even as He seeks to call us back.
prayer: Dear Lord, in my weakness and with my sins, Help me hear Your loving voice calling me. Amen.
original_content:
03/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~LOVE ON THE STREETS OF JERUSALEM

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Jesus turned and said to them, "Daughters of Jerusalem, do not weep for Me;
weep for yourselves and for you children." (Lk. 23:28)

Our Lesson for Today:
Wouldn't we have cried too, if we had been standing with those women? ~ And 
wouldn't you think that Jesus would have wanted our tears? When we suffer, don't
we appreciate sympathy. But not our Lord Jesus. Dragging His cross through the
streets of Jerusalem, he says, "Do not weep for Me."

Why not? ~ Because all was well with Him. ~ He knew that the way His Father had 
chosen to free the world from sin's hellish curse was by His making those bloody 
footprints to a hill called Calvary. ~ As the loving Son of the Eternal Father and as 
the everlasting friend of sinners, He was willing to walk that path...

It is time to check our heart and life again, isn't it? ~ Any sin there that we've become 
comfortable with? ~ Any sin that we've willingly made our bedfellow? ~ Is there any sin 
that we've told God to keep His fingers off? ~ Well then perhaps it's time to hear His 
words of love warning us, even as He seeks to call us back...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, in my weakness and with my sins, Help me
hear Your loving voice calling me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Tell the people of Israel, 'Look, your King is coming to you. He is humble, riding on a donkey ~ even on a donkey's colt. ' (Matthew 21:5)
reflection: Some would say, 'What kind of King would ride a donkey in a parade?' There were no chariots with armed guards ~ No marching bands ~ No prancing steeds. ' "Hosanna, " they shouted to Him, but what kind of King was He? Well my answer is, ~ Jesus is the eternal God whose throne fills the heavens and whose scepter casts it's shadow over all the earth. But yes, He rides into Jerusalem in all lowliness to show that He's also man. Yes He became one of us, took on our flesh to do what none of us could do, to carry out the heavenly mission of salvation. Because he came ~ in such humble form, many missed Him. Oh yes, they cheered when that strange parade went by, but they went home and forgot all about Him. But thank God He hasn't forgotten me. His coming in the flesh and His humble entrance into Jerusalem were His way of saying, "How could I ever forget you? I've become one of you. I came to be with you and to die for you on Calvary's cross." So let us sing: "Hosanna to the Highest."
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to see the reason behind Your humility, and then ride on into my heart. Amen.
original_content:
03/21/2010~~~food for thought~~~HOSANNA TO OUR KING...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Tell the people of Israel, 'Look, your King is coming to you. 
He is humble, riding on a donkey ~ even on a donkey's colt.' (Mt. 21:5)

Our Lesson for Today:
Some would say, 'What kind of King would ride a donkey in a parade?'
There were no chariots with armed guards ~ No marching bands ~ No
prancing steeds.' "Hosanna," they shouted to Him, but what kind of
King was He?

Well my answer is, ~ Jesus is the eternal God whose throne fills the 
heavens and whose scepter casts it's shadow over all the earth. But 
yes, He rides into Jerusalem in all lowliness to show that He's also man.

Yes He became one of us, took on our flesh to do what none of us could 
do, to carry out the heavenly mission of salvation. Because he came ~
in such humble form, many missed Him. Oh yes, they cheered when that
strange parade went by, but they went home and forgot all about Him.

But thank God He hasn't forgotten me. His coming in the flesh and His
humble entrance into Jerusalem were His way of saying, "How could I
ever forget you? I've become one of you. I came to be with you and to 
die for you on Calvary's cross." So let us sing: "Hosanna to the Highest."

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to see the reason behind Your humility,
and then ride on into my heart...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Hosanna to the Son of David! ~ Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord! ~ Hosanna in the highest! ~(Matthew 21:9)
reflection: Have you ever wondered what Jesus' thoughts were as He rode in that Palm Sunday parade? ~ He had no false dreams about where His ride was taking Him. All the palm waving and hosanna shouting didn't fill Him with delusions of grandeur. Earlier, on the way to the parade, He had told His disciples exactly what lay ahead of Him. It surely was not the keys to the city, but a cross out side it. ~ But that cross would unlock the doors to the heavenly Jerusalem. With His crown of thorns and His throne of pain, He would pay for the world's sin. ~ From this Savior-King would come victory such as the world has never seen and will always need. The more I see in this King, the one who came to die for my sins and prepare eternal life for me in heaven, the more I will shout my hosannas to Him today, tomorrow, and in eternity.
prayer: Dear Lord, show me Your cross' victory over sin so that I would shout hosanna all my days. Amen.

Hosanna to the Son of David! ~ Blessed is He who comes in the
name of the Lord! ~ Hosanna in the highest! ~(Mt. 21:9)

His ride was taking Him. All the palm waving and hosanna shouting 
didn't fill Him with delusions of grandeur...

Earlier, on the way to the parade, He had told His disciples exactly

With His crown of thorns and His throne of pain, He would pay for

The more I see in this King, the one who came to die for my sins and

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: They brought the donkey and the colt, placed their cloaks on them and Jesus sat on them. A very large crowd spread their cloaks on the road, and others cut branches from the trees and spread them on the road. (Matthew 21:7, 8)
reflection: They praised Jesus with their lips and hands that first Palm Sunday. The disciples did it by following Jesus' orders and fetching the donkey. The people did it by rolling out the red carpet of their own cloaks and palm branches. Yes they eagerly praised Him, even though few fully knew the right reason why. Today we celebrate this event on Palm Sunday. That day should remind us to guard against superficial acclaim of Christ.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me live my hosannas. Amen.

03/23/2010~~~food for thought~~~LET US SING HOSANNA WITH OUR LIPS AND OUR LIVES...

They brought the donkey and the colt, placed their cloaks on them and

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to The Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Then he [Moses] took the Book of the Covenant and read it to the people. they all responded again, "We will do everything the Lord has commanded. We will obey. Then Moses sprinkled the blood from the basin over the people and said, "This blood confirms the covenant the Lord has made with you in giving you these laws." (Exodus 24:7, 8)
reflection: To understand this unusual covenant ratification ceremony, we need to understand the Bible's view, [God's view] of sin and forgiveness. ~ God is the sovereign Judge of the universe. ~ He is also absolutely holy. ~ As the holy Judge of all, he condemns sin and judges it worthy of death. In the Old T. God accepted the death of an animal as a substitute for the sinner. The animal's shed blood was proof that one life had to be given for another. ~ So on the one hand, blood symbolized the death of an animal, but it also symbolized the life that was spared as a result. But of course this was only a temporary provision, looking forward to the death of Jesus Christ.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for the sacrifice you made on Calvary's Mountain for me. Amen.
original_content:
03/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~DEATH OF ONE MEANS LIFE FOR ALL...

Our Bible verses for Today:
Then he [Moses] took the Book of the Covenant and read it to the people.
they all responded again, "We will do everything the Lord has commanded.
We will obey...Then Moses sprinkled the blood from the basin over the people

In the Old T. God accepted the death of an animal as a substitute for the sinner. The

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Lord is my shepherd. (We should recognize this as being the first line of Psalms 23:1
reflection: The new T. calls Jesus the Good Shepherd (John 10:11). the Great Shepherd (Hebrews 13:20) The Head Shepherd (1 Peter 5:4) As the Lord is the Good Shepherd, so we are His sheep ~ not frightened, passive animals, but obedient followers, wise enough to follow one who will lead us in the right places and in right ways. As we will see in the next few days, this psalm does not focus on the animal-like qualities of sheep but on the discipleship qualities of those who follow. Let us in the next few days examine our discipleship qualities, to see where we stand. I will share my thoughts on the rest of the this week Psalm.
original_content:
03/25/2010~~~food for thought~~~KEEP YOUR EYES ON THE GOOD SHEPHERD...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
The Lord is my shepherd. 
(We should recognize this as being the first line of, Ps. 23:1)

Our Lesson for Today:
The new T. calls Jesus the Good Shepherd (Jn. 10:11).
the Great Shepherd (Heb. 13:20)
The Head Shepherd (1 Pet. 5:4)

As the Lord is the Good Shepherd, so we are His sheep ~ not frightened, 
passive animals, but obedient followers, wise enough to follow one who
will lead us in the right places and in right ways. 

As we will see in the next few days, this psalm does not focus on the animal-like 
qualities of sheep but on the discipleship qualities of those who follow. Let us in 
the next few days examine our discipleship qualities, to see where we stand. 
I will share my thoughts on the rest of the this week Psalm...
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

When you recognize the Good Shepherd, follow Him!!!

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He lets me rest in green meadows; He leads me beside peaceful streams. He renews my strength. He guides me along right paths, bring honor to His name. (Psalms 2, 3)
reflection: When we allow God, our Shepherd, to guide us we will have contentment. When we choose to sin and go our own way, we surely can not blame God for the predicaments we find ourselves in. Our Shepherd knows the "green meadows" and "peaceful streams" that will restore us. We can only reach these places by following Him obediently. Let us remember this the next time we are tempted to go our own way rather than the Shepherd's way.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to always keep my feet on the correct path, the path that you have set for me. Amen.
original_content:

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Even when I walk through the dark valley of death, I will not be afraid, for You are close beside me. Your rod and Your staff protect and comfort me. (Psalms 23:4)
reflection: Death often is a frightening thing, because we are entirely helpless in its presence. We can struggle with other enemies ~ pain, suffering, disease, injury ~ but strength and courage cannot overcome death. It has the final word. Only one person can walk us through death's dark valley and bring us safely to the other side. He is the God of life, our Shepherd. Because life is uncertain, we should follow this Shepherd who offers us eternal comfort.
prayer: Dear Lord and Savior, lead me on to life eternal. Amen.
original_content:
03/27/2010~~~food for thought~~~TRULY PROTECTED...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Even when I walk through the dark valley of death, I will not be afraid, 
for You are close beside me. Your rod and Your staff protect and
comfort me...(Ps. 23:4)

Our Lesson for Today:
Death often is a frightening thing, because we are entirely helpless in its presence.
We can struggle with other enemies ~ pain, suffering, disease, injury ~ but strength
and courage cannot overcome death...

It has the final word...Only one person can walk us through death's dark valley
and bring us safely to the other side. He is the God of life, our Shepherd...

Because life is uncertain, we should follow this Shepherd who offers us eternal comfort...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord and Savior, lead me on to life eternal...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.
No one can come to the Father except through me." John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You prepare a feast for me in the presence of my enemies. You welcome me as a guest, anointing my head with oil. My cup overflows with blessings. Surely Your goodness and unfailing love will pursue me all the days of my life, and I will live in the house of the Lord forever.
reflection: It is comforting to know that God offers us protection even when enemies surround us. In the closing scene of this psalm, we also see that believers are promised that they will live with God. Yes God promises to guide and protect us throughout our life and to bring us into His house to live forever. IF WE WILL BUT ACCEPT HIS OFFER.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for Your protection and Your promise that I will live in Your house forever. Amen.

You prepare a feast for me in the presence of my enemies.
You welcome me as a guest, anointing my head with oil.
My cup overflows with blessings...

Surely Your goodness and unfailing love will pursue me all the
days of my life, and I will live in the house of the Lord forever...

Our Lesson for Today:

enemies surround us. In the closing scene of this psalm, we also

IF WE WILL BUT ACCEPT HIS OFFER...

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness. (Hebrews 9:22f)
reflection: Have you ever been asked or wondered, 'Why does forgiveness require the shedding of blood?' Be sure of this, this is not some unreasonable decree on the part of a bloodthirsty God as some have suggested. The answer to this age-old question is, there is no greater symbol of life than blood, blood keeps us alive. Jesus shed His blood ~ gave His life ~ for our sins so that we wouldn't have to experience spiritual death, eternal separation from God. Jesus is the source of life, not death. He gave His own life to pay our penalty for us so that we might live. After shedding His blood for us, Christ rose from the grave and proclaimed victory over sin and death. Yes it is difficult to understand this kind of love and forgiveness ~ BUT oh how much better this world would be if we too could live this kind of example.
prayer: Dear Lord, instill in me a Christ-like love. Amen.
original_content:
03/29/2010~~~food for thought~~~WHY THE NEED TO SHED BLOOD?

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness...(Heb. 9:22f)

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you ever been asked or wondered, 'Why does forgiveness require the shedding of blood?'

Be sure of this, this is not some unreasonable decree on the part of a blood-thirsty God as some
have suggested.The answer to this age-old question is, there is no greater symbol of life than
blood, blood keeps us alive. Jesus shed His blood ~ gave His life ~ for our sins so that we wouldn't 
have to experience spiritual death, eternal separation from God...

Jesus is the source of life, not death. He gave His own life to pay our penalty for us so that we might 
live. After shedding His blood for us, Christ rose from the grave and proclaimed victory over sin and 
death...

Yes it is difficult to understand this kind of love and forgiveness ~ BUT oh how much better this world
would be if we too could live this kind of example...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, instill in me a Christ-like love...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: He took the bread. and gave it to them, saying, "This is my body given for you.". He took the cup, saying, "This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you." (Luke 22:19, 20)
reflection: That Passover evening Jesus had plenty on His mind. Ahead of Him lay a night and a day packed with the worst men could ever invent. Who could have blamed Him if He had told those disciples to leave Him alone? But He didn't ! ! ! His love for sinners wouldn't let Him. That love even moved Him to leave a parting gift for them, a blessed inheritance that would help them through the ages. Looking at His disciple, then and now, He saw how they would need assurance of sin forgiven, how often their wounded hearts would need special healing. So in love He gave them a miracle. He left them the treasure of His Holy Supper, in which He gives His true body with the bread and His true blood with the wine so that penitent sinners might be assured of forgiveness."Go in peace, " He tells the penitent, "your sins are forgiven as surely as My body and blood prepared that forgiveness which you now have received." Now pray:
prayer: Thank You God for Remembering me, help me remember what a Savior I have and what He offers me in His meal. Amen.
original_content:
03/30/2010~~~food for thought~~~HE REMEMBERS ME

Our Bible verses for Today:
He took the bread . and gave it to them, saying, "This is my body given
for you." . He took the cup, saying, "This cup is the new covenant in
my blood, which is poured out for you." (Lk. 22:19, 20)

Our Lesson for Today:
That Passover evening Jesus had plenty on His mind. Ahead of Him lay a night 
and a day packed with the worst men could ever invent. Who could have blamed 
Him if He had told those disciples to leave Him alone? But He didn't ! ! ! His love
for sinners wouldn't let Him. That love even moved Him to leave a parting gift for 
them, a blessed inheritance that would help them through the ages.

Looking at His disciple, then and now, He saw how they would need assurance of
sin forgiven, how often their wounded hearts would need special healing. So in love
He gave them a miracle. He left them the treasure of His Holy Supper, in which He 
gives His true body with the bread and His true blood with the wine so that penitent
sinners might be assured of forgiveness.

"Go in peace," He tells the penitent, "your sins are forgiven as surely as My body 
and blood prepared that forgiveness which you now have received." Now pray:

Prayer Suggestion:
Thank You God for Remembering me, help me remember
what a Savior I have and what He offers me in His meal...Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Father, forgive them, for they do not know what they are doing. (Luke 23:34)
reflection: The sound of the hammer had barely faded when the Savior spoke. His first sentence from the cross was not a cry of pain or a curse of hatred. It was a prayer asking His Father to forgive those who crucified Him."Father, " He prayed ~ that word speaks of the enormity of their crime. They were killing God's own Son. Wouldn't His holy hand be already streaking down to seize the guilty and grind them into pieces? "Forgive, " Jesus continued, using a word that meant to dismiss, to send out of sight. ~ His Father knew why Jesus prayed this. ~ His Son was on the that cross paying for the sins of these people too. ~ His sacrifice made His prayer the mightiest ever spoken."Them." Jesus said. He mentioned no names so I can put mine there. ~ You are invited to do the same. ~ He had Luke record it so we could read it.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me appreciate that You were praying about me. Oh how I need Your prayer daily! Amen.
original_content:
03/31/2010 ~~~ food for thought~~~FORGIVE THEM...
Take the time to really grasp what this means...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
Father, forgive them, for they do not know what
they are doing. (Lk. 23:34)

Our Lesson for Today:
The sound of the hammer had barely faded when the Savior spoke.
His first sentence from the cross was not a cry of pain or a curse of hatred.
It was a prayer asking His Father to forgive those who crucified Him...

"Father," He prayed ~ that word speaks of the enormity of their crime.
They were killing God's own Son. Wouldn't His holy hand be already streaking 
down to seize the guilty and grind them into pieces?

"Forgive," Jesus continued, using a word that meant to dismiss, to send out
of sight. ~ His Father knew why Jesus prayed this. ~ His Son was on the that
cross paying for the sins of these people too. ~ His sacrifice made His prayer
the mightiest ever spoken."Them." Jesus said. He mentioned no names so
I can put mine there. ~ You are invited to do the same. ~ He had Luke record it 
so we could read it...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me appreciate that You were praying about me.
Oh how I need Your prayer daily! Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through me." - John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I tell you the truth, today you will be with Me in Paradise. (Luke 23:43)
reflection: As the criminal next to Jesus, draws is dying breath, he turned to Jesus and said, "Remember me in Your Kingdom." This was his plea for forgiveness. Yes, one may say it was to simple ~ but Jesus recognized the man's sincerity."Remember me, " and Christ accepted him. To me this says loud and clear ~ your deeds will not save you, but your faith in Christ will. It is never to late to turn to God. Even in His misery, Jesus had mercy on this criminal who decided to believe in Him. Yes, Christ accepts us in spite of our past. BUT our life will be much more useful and fulfilling if we turn to God early, but even those who repent at the very last moment will be with God in paradise.
prayer: Dear Lord, please, in Your mercy and grace, so promise me. Amen.
original_content:
04/01/2010~~~food for thought~~~A WORD OF PROMISE...

Our Bible Verse for Today:
I tell you the truth, today you will be with Me in Paradise...(Lk. 23:43)

Our Lesson for Today:
As the criminal next to Jesus, draws is dying breath, he turned to Jesus and
said, "Remember me in Your Kingdom." This was his plea for forgiveness.
Yes, one may say it was to simple ~ but Jesus recognized the man's sincerity.
"Remember me," and Christ accepted him...

To me this says loud and clear ~ your deeds will not save you, but your faith
in Christ will. It is never to late to turn to God. Even in His misery, Jesus had 
mercy on this criminal who decided to believe in Him. Yes, Christ accepts us
in spite of our past. BUT our life will be much more useful and fulfilling if we
turn to God early, but even those who repent at the very last moment will be
with God in paradise...

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, please, in Your mercy and grace, so promise me...Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
